Legal_Issue: Whether the Canadian Human Rights Commission erred in dismissing complaints under s. 44(3)(b) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient evidence to warrant further inquiry
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate reasonable grounds for inquiry
Credibility_Factor: Not explicitly challenged; based on investigation findings
Legal_Rule: Commission may dismiss a complaint if an inquiry is not warranted
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged racial discrimination by Canada Post and its employees
Outcome_on_Merits: No violation found due to insufficient evidence
Review_Standard: No error in law or breach of procedural fairness
Key_Evidence_Considered: Investigation report, complaint details, conciliation attempt records
Defendant_Response: Not detailed, but investigation did not support claim
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, witness statements, investigation findings
Resolution_Mechanism: Investigation and conciliation followed by Commission decision
Legal_Provision: s. 44(3)(b) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Applicable_Process: Complaint investigation, conciliation, dismissal, judicial review
Jurisdiction: Federal (Canadian Human Rights Commission and Federal Court)
Governing_Rule: s. 44(3)(b) CHRA allows dismissal if inquiry not warranted
